Astronomy is the study of the universe and everything in it. That includes planets, stars, galaxies, and even space itself. There are many different types of astronomers, but most of them work to understand the things that make up our universe. They study how stars are born, how planets move, and even what makes up the things that we can see in the night sky. They also try to learn more about black holes and dark matter. 
Astronomy is a very old science, but it's still very new in some ways. New discoveries are made all the time, and scientists are always looking for new ways to learn about the universe. They use special tools like telescopes to look at far away objects, and they also use computers to help them analyze the data that they collect. Some astronomers are also looking for life on other planets. They want to know if we are alone in the universe or if there are other living things out there.
